choices.C: Have accounts checked by the cloud systems administrator once per day to ensure active accounts are still valid.
choices.A: Have the user contact the cloud systems administrator to disable the account when it is no longer needed.
choices.B: When users leave the company, ensure an account disablement request is initiated and will be fulfilled in less than four hours.
choices.D: Reboot directory services servers once a day to ensure all account disablement requests are committed.

discussion.content: Bis corect BC- there is a process not involving the leaving user, NOT A because "user contact the cloud systems" they will never contact anyone
I say B,. it is not a good ides to leave this to the user.
CompTIA question are very tricky. No where in the question did they say employee. They are talking about cloud and unused resources not SSO. The right answer for me is A

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the BEST way to ensure accounts in a cloud environment are disabled as soon as they no longer need to be active?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
compression has nothing to do with securing the data

questions.question_text:
A cloud administrator is moving a healthcare application to the public cloud. The application needs to be secured while data is being stored.
Which of the following technologies should be deployed to BEST meet the requirements?

A cloud administrator is required to implement an MFA solution using soft tokens.
Which of the following should the administrator implement to meet this requirement? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BD
A is not a soft token

choices.D: Compression 1.8:1 Deduplication 2.7:1 Overall savings 4.2:1 Average latency 1.2ms
choices.C: Compression 1.3:1 Deduplication 3.1:1 Overall savings 4.3:1 Average latency 900us
choices.B: Compression 1.5:1 Deduplication 1.8:1 Overall savings 2.2:1 Average latency 600us
choices.A: Compression 1:1 Deduplication 4:1 Overall savings 4:1 Average latency 1.0ms

discussion.content: C. is the obvious correct answer - based on the sub millisecond latency requirement (<1ms) and overall savings needing to be at LEAST 4:1

Don't even need to be a tech of any sort to get this one. It's called knowing basic numbers. Which is the only one that is over 4:1 AND under 1ms? So C is obvious. It does make me wonder who\what\when decided these answers.

Why is the obvious and correct answer sometimes not the answer examtopics.com has labelled as "correct"? The answer here is obviously C, so who from examtopics.com coded D as the correct answer with a green border around it?

comments.content: i think very rarely. so its good to read the discussions cause a lot of these questions have wrong answers.
Agreed. I feel like if there is a consensus on an answer on examtopics from the commenters over a period of time, the answer should change to what the majority of us think it is

discussion.content: Does anyone actually read these and make corrections?
The answer has to be B or C, the question is asking for sub-millisecond latency.

comments.content: The answer is C (Overall savings 4.3:1). The question is asking for "achieve 4:1 storage efficiency" too.

questions.question_text: A cloud administrator has deployed a new all-flash storage array with deduplication and compression enabled, and moved some of the VMs into it. The goal was to achieve 4:1 storage efficiency while maintaining sub-millisecond latency. Which of the following results would BEST suit the requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
because of high use

choices.D: Add a vCPU to the database server, keeping the same RAM and storage resource specifications.
choices.B: Add RAM to the web server, keeping the same vCPU and storage resource specifications.
choices.A: Add RAM to the database server, keeping the same vCPU and storage resource specifications.
choices.C: Add a vCPU to each fileshare server, keeping the same RAM and storage resource specifications.
